definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: While personally a modest man, Dr LEE was a bold leader.
sentences.chinese: 李博士为人谦和，同时也是一位大无畏的领导。

sentences.english: Facing the death, he has a good laugh, this is the what kind dauntless spirit.
sentences.chinese: 面对死亡，他仰天大笑，这是何等的大无畏精神。

sentences.english: They withstood the tests with wonderful power and sublime heroism.
sentences.chinese: 他们凭着神奇的力量和大无畏的英雄气概经受了考验。

sentences.english: Their fearlessness inspires others to overcome their own fears.
sentences.chinese: 她们的大无畏精神激励别人战胜自身的恐惧。

sentences.english: The people of Linzhou displayed a fearless spirit.
sentences.chinese: 林州人真有一股大无畏的气概。

sentences.english: The author characterized the leading character in the novel as a dauntless hero.
sentences.chinese: 作者将小说中的主人公描绘成一个大无畏的英雄。

sentences.english: But I am abrupt so undaunted be like to have me only.
sentences.chinese: 但是我忽然这样大无畏的似乎只有我一个。

sentences.english: The social practice also made me more and more scrupulous and dauntless .
sentences.chinese: 社会实践也使我越来越严格和大无畏的。

definition: to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
